14 void printGrid(const std::vector<std::vector<int>>& grid, const std::vector<Cell>& path = std::vector<Cell>()) {
15  // Create a copy of the grid to mark the path
16  std::vector<std::vector<std::string>> pathGrid(grid.size(), std::vector<std::string>(grid[0].size()));
17 
18  for (size_t i = 0; i < pathGrid.size(); i++) {
19  for (size_t j = 0; j < pathGrid[0].size(); j++) {
20  pathGrid[i][j] = std::to_string(grid[i][j]); // Initialize with obstacles or empty spaces
21  }
22  }
23 
24  for (const Cell& cell : path) {
25  pathGrid[cell.row][cell.col] = "*"; // Mark path cells with asterisk
26  }
27 
28  // Print the path-marked grid
29  for (size_t i = 0; i < pathGrid.size(); i++) {
30  for (size_t j = 0; j < pathGrid[0].size(); j++) {
31  std::cout << pathGrid[i][j] << " ";
32  }
33  std::cout << std::endl;
34  }
35 }
36 
37 // Function to trim leading and trailing spaces from a string
38 std::string trim(const std::string& s) {
39  size_t start = s.find_first_not_of(" \t\r\n");
40  size_t end = s.find_last_not_of(" \t\r\n");
41  if (start == std::string::npos || end == std::string::npos) {
42  // String is empty or contains only spaces
43  return "";
44  }
45  return s.substr(start, end - start + 1);
46 }

152 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
153  // Replace "your_excel_file.xlsx" with the path to your Excel file
154  ros::init(argc, argv, "ROSEnvironment");
155  ros::NodeHandle nh;
156  ROSNode *rosnode = new ROSNode(nh);
157  while(ros::ok()){
158  rosnode->sendCmd(0.1,0,0,0,0,0);
159  ROS_INFO_STREAM(rosnode->returnOdom());
160  ros::spin();
161  }
